str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A king, ruler, but in some passages clearly to be translated: emperor. Probably from basis; a sovereign.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.
A prolonged form of a primary verb; to look closely at, i.e. perceive; by extension to visit.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To recline, especially at a dinner-table. From ana and keimai; to recline.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To put on, clothe (another). From en and duno; to invest with clothing.
A marriage, wedding, wedding-ceremony; plur: a wedding-feast. Of uncertain affinity; nuptials.
A garment, raiment, clothing. From enduo; apparel.
